Kim Jong Il Praised 
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il is a gifted thinker and a great master of leadership, said Ricardo Chavez Gutieres, chairman of the National Executive Committee of the Mexican Communist Party, addressing round-table talks sponsored by the party on Nov. 20 on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
 Kim Jong Il has defended socialism and pushed forward the building of a great prosperous powerful nation with Songun politics in reliance upon the army, he noted, adding: This leadership method is just and unique. Socialism cannot be defended without firmly relying on the army under the present situation.

Legislation on Press Reform Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Press Trade Unions of south Korea held a rally in demand of the legislation on the press reform in front of the National Assembly building on November 18, according to south Korean KBS.
 The organization said that the "Broadcasting Committee" intends to transfer the public property of the people to a big businessman. It demanded that the authorities adopt a law on the press reform to underscore the public nature of the press and check privatization.

Mongolian Ambassador Gives Receptions 
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- Janchivdorjyn Lomvo, ambassador of Mongolia to the DPRK, gave receptions at the embassy here on Nov. 23 and 25 on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the proclamation of the Republic in Mongolia.
 Present on invitations were Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Committee, and other officials concerned.    
 Speeches were made at the receptions.

Greetings to Mongolian President
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Mongolian President Natsagyn Bagabandi on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the proclamation of the Republic in Mongolia.
 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message sincerely wished him and the Mongolian people fresh success in their work for the prosperity of the country.
